    This is the personal homepage of Elad Meidar, a web developer and an entrepreneur specializing in Ruby on Rails. I hang around Fort Lauderdale, FL and Tel-Aviv in Israel, and i am currently running Nautilus6 so Feel free to contact me regarding projects :).
    I am a proud member of RailsBridge, Helping new Rails developers get into our world and also contributed a few Patches to the Ruby on Rails core.

GET

Bag O' Links - 25/1/2010

  • Rails 3 – ActionMailer’s new API – A brief overview on the new mailer API. another thing changed.
  • Data.gov – The purpose of Data.gov is to increase public access to high value, machine readable datasets generated by the Executive Branch of the Federal Government. Eat that lorem ipsum.
  • Use CloudFront when you need to – a no-use case by the guys behind AudioBox, which is very cool on it’s own.
  • How to work with a lawyer on a startup – and i add “with a close by shotgun”.
  • A successful Git branching model – or, how to make your team work well under a Git umbrella.
  • Search fundamentals: basic indexing – not database indexing, but data indexing. although most of us don’t write web crawlers for fun and profit, i am pretty sure those methods will come handy some day.
  • Getting up to speed with Rails 3 – it’s almost here, here’s how to play with it now.
  • UTC vs Ruby, ActiveRecord, Sinatra, Heroku and Postgres – Don’t we all love Time and Date ?
  • Getting non-rational with MongoDB – Screencast from the latest RubyConf.
  • font-face and browser support – get in my browser already!. really, that’s probably the thing i look forward the most.
  • don’t use try-catch – it seems not to be a language specific issue, people use exceptions when they shouldn’t.
  • CSS3’s new shiny visuals – have fun.
  • Reflections from ‘The Compleat Rubyist’ – seems like it was fun, how come i didn’t know about it :(.
  • Design your application for a cloud deployment – good tips.
  • Managed hosting for CouchDB – they haz one.
  • Rapid application deployment with Git – good to see that Webbynode are bringing their article base to Slicehost’s level, aside from that, they did something really cool here :)
  • ActiveRecord 3.0 goes wild – looks neat, not going to be so-much-fun upgrading 2.x apps down the road.
  • CSS pseudo – know them! – a list, a browser support table, all the fun in one article.
  • RVM – just do it – having multiple versions of ruby on your machine, the easy way.
  • Better javascript Classes – know your ways, oh great javascript warrior.
  • Rails != Scaffolding – personal opinion: scaffolding should die. Sarah puts it in nicer words :).
  • Automate actions on MacOS – Automator, you are worthless from now on.

Treasures

  • NavLinks – an easy way to create navigation links for your Rails application.
  • MagickInstaller – a script that installs Rmagick on MacOS (L/SL). supposed to be kept up to date with versions.
  • SlimScrooge – another ActiveRecord optimizer.
  • TemplateInliner – and an ActionView optimizer!.
